Schedule

Date Title Speaker Description Status Extra
09/08/2014 Introduction Introduction to this club. We will also cover some basic commands in linux shell. Scheduled

N/A
09/15/2014 Garbage Collection Jiaqi Li Most modern programming language manages memory intelligently. They attempt to reclaim garbage, or memory occupied by objects that are no longer in use by the program. This talk will go over the mechanism of modern Garbage Collection and tips to use it to your advantage. Scheduled https://gist.github.com/lijiaqigreat/3f9b644d60424faf1991

09/22/2014 Haskell Nick Lewchenko How can you perform useful computations without for-loops, while-loops, or variables? With function application! This talk will explain the basics of the *Functional Programming* paradigm and give interactive examples of what can be accomplished with Haskell's first-class functions. Scheduled prime generating algorithm

 conversation bot

09/29/2014 Web Development with Django Ethan S. Blackburn focus on Django web framework Scheduled N/A
10/06/2014 Map the functors Nick Lewchenko what is a monad? Amonoid? The functional paradigm has many useful concepts for organizing code in any project, but they tend to have very strange, mathematical names that don't help beginners trying to learn them. This talks explain what some of those concepts mean and give examples of how they can be used Scheduled N/A
10/13/2014 Google Translation Dr.Scannell Ever wonder how Google Translate works? How do computers "learn" to translate between languages without any linguistic knowledge? The easiest way to answer this question is to try it yourself, by learning to translate between languages you don't speak! This will be an interactive talk - audience members will work together to translate texts between two "extraterrestrial" languages, starting with only a small collection of parallel sentences intercepted from alien radio transmissions. Scheduled N/A
